cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1065 MI...1715 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Greg Advisory Number 36 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP072017 200 AM PDT Wed Jul 26 2017
...POORLY ORGANIZED GREG MOVING NORTHWESTWARD TOWARD THE CENTRAL PACIFIC...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...17.8N 139.5W ABOUT 1065 MI...1715 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...NW OR 305 DEGREES AT 13 MPH...20 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1006 MB...29.71 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Greg was located near latitude 17.8 North, longitude 139.5 West. The depression is moving toward the northwest near 13 mph (20 km/h), and this general motion is forecast to continue through today. A gradual turn toward the west-northwest and then the west is expected tonight and on Thursday.
Maximum sustained winds are near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. Slow weakening is expected during the next couple of days, and Greg is forecast to degenerate into a remnant low by Wednesday night.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1006 mb (29.71 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Beven
NNNN
